name: Atlas
headline: Operating system for restaurants, focusing on Southeast Asia
description: Atlas is building the operating system for restaurants. Atlas is the easiest way to start, run and grow any restaurant online and offline. We are the team that previously built Grain, a venture-backed online restaurant, to millions in revenue. Team and investors are from Grain, Accenture, Microsoft, Udacity, McKinsey, Salesforce, Y Combinator and others. https://atlas.kitchen

founders.name: Yi Sung (Sung) Yong, Founder
founders.description: Co-creator of Grain and Atlas. When I was young, my aspiration was to be a clown with a medical degree. Currently distracted by my obsession to build great products that can change people‚Äôs lives for the better.

founders.name: Shawn Liam, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder of Atlas. Lives and breathes in the intersection of tech and design. Oversees the product strategy and direction at Atlas. In a previous life led UX and Design at Malaysian satellite TV and content conglomerate Astro. Mexican cuisine lover, beer nerd,  loves adventure, rock climbing and the outdoors.

founders.name: Ernest Sim, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder of Atlas. Also the co-founder of Grain, a venture-backed (Series B) online restaurant in Singapore. I'm passionate about F&B tech and believe that the future of food is inevitable, and it will come whether we like it or not. The real question is, will we watch it happen? Or make it happen?

In my free time, I love to sing and play music. I am creative by heart, and I have a knack for figuring computers out. I enjoy brainstorming and ideation.

Speediest way to get your own world-class online storefront up and running, including doing your own deliveries.

Allow customers to view menu and order and pay directly from their tables.

### And everything in between
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/662630642b31a27be39b6066/662b5b79e9208aba33534b8f_Vectornew%20icons.svg)
###### Atlas Aggregator
Sync up all menus, orders, and stock from 3rd party food delivery platforms like magic: Grab, Deliveroo, Foodpanda, etc.
![Aggregator](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/662630642b31a27be39b6066/66433272e0c73a922a7f821a_Aggregatoraggregator%202EDIT.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/662630642b31a27be39b6066/662b5b792a38d771e23228b7_Layer_1new%20icons-1.svg)
###### Atlas Connect
Connect all your existing software back into the Atlas platform. No need to toggle between your 101 apps anymore.
![Connect](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/662630642b31a27be39b6066/664f076bea4881d9ce0ccb51_Product%20image.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/662630642b31a27be39b6066/662b5b79e9208aba33534baa_Layer_1new%20icons.svg)
###### Atlas Smart Logistics
Atlas will book and guarantee service levels for 3rd party deliveries (e.g. dealing with customer order changes, rebookings, etc.).
![Smart logistics](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/662630642b31a27be39b6066/664b0320d842cbb5d6e840f3_Product%20imageConnect.png)

## Letter from our team
May 2024
Running a restaurant is tough enough already. But it shouldn‚Äôt be this tough. With Atlas, we are here to help you focus on things that matter. The business model for restaurants is fundamentally changing because everything is going online. People will transact more with their devices. Restaurants will need to find different ways to reach customers and optimise their operations (deliveries, pickup, pre-orders, social ordering, virtual brands, cloud kitchens, food aggregators, etc.).There will be a need for unified and seamless online and offline food commerce experiences. Atlas believes that merging the omnichannel worlds into a single source of truth (customer, orders, menus, products, etc.) can 10X the consumer experience.Atlas will develop these tools to support these business models of the future of restaurants ‚Äî for you and for our friends in the industry (PS: We are also the folks behind the online restaurant, Grain!).Atlas is our love letter to restaurants, and we‚Äôre just getting started.

## Letter from our team
May 2024
Running a restaurant is tough enough already. But it shouldn‚Äôt be this tough. With Atlas, we are here to help you focus on things that matter. The business model for restaurants is fundamentally changing because everything is going online. People will transact more with their devices. Restaurants will need to find different ways to reach customers and optimise their operations (deliveries, pickup, pre-orders, social ordering, virtual brands, cloud kitchens, food aggregators, etc.).There will be a need for unified and seamless online and offline food commerce experiences. Atlas believes that merging the omnichannel worlds into a single source of truth (customer, orders, menus, products, etc.) can 10X the consumer experience.Atlas will develop these tools to support these business models of the future of restaurants ‚Äî for you and for our friends in the industry (PS: We are also the folks behind the online restaurant, Grain!).Atlas is our love letter to restaurants, and we‚Äôre just getting started.

Atlas is a Singapore-based company founded in 2021, part of Y Combinator Batch S21, that has set out to revolutionize the restaurant industry in Southeast Asia with its integrated operating system. Its mission is straightforward: to be the easiest way to start, run, and grow any restaurant, whether online or offline.

The brains behind Atlas come with serious credentials‚Äîthey previously built Grain, a successful online restaurant that saw millions in revenue. This experience has equipped them with the insights to tackle the challenges restaurants face today, especially in a fast-evolving market that increasingly relies on digital solutions. The team boasts backgrounds from major players like Accenture, Microsoft, McKinsey, and Salesforce, which adds layers of depth to their expertise.

At its core, Atlas‚Äô tech simplifies multiple restaurant operations‚Äîserving as a unified platform where restaurant owners can manage online storefronts, point-of-sale systems, third-party logistics, menu syncs, and customer insights, all while leveraging AI to enhance services. Their offerings are designed to streamline processes across multiple channels, ensuring that restaurants can effectively cater to their customers regardless of the delivery mechanism‚Äîbe it dine-in, takeout, or third-party delivery platforms like Grab and Deliveroo.

For those restaurants just getting started, Atlas offers a basic package starting at $79/month with no hidden fees or long-term contracts. This allows restaurant operators to focus on what they do best‚Äîserve great food‚Äîwhile Atlas handles the heavy lifting in terms of technology. 

Currently, Atlas has a lean team of 11 individuals, but they're making waves by delighting hundreds of restaurants across sunny Singapore. Their growth suggests not just strong demand but also validation of their product's effectiveness in navigating the complex landscape of restaurant management. They also offer a noteworthy, risk-free incentive: a 100-day money-back guarantee for users who aren‚Äôt satisfied with their systems.

In summary, if you're looking for a robust operating system tailored for the modern restaurant environment, look no further than Atlas. They are committed to helping restaurateurs not just survive, but thrive amidst the changing tides of the F&B industry.
